data.value: Bivariate spline approximation over a rectangular mesh on a sphere.
Can be used for smoothing data.

Data value exactness at the poles
and

.  If True, the value is considered to be the right function value, and it will be fitted exactly. If False, the value will be considered to be a data value just like the other data values.  Defaults to False.

Currently, only the smoothing spline approximation (
and
in the FITPACK routine) is supported.  The exact least-squares spline approximation is not implemented yet.
When actually performing the interpolation, the requested
values must lie within the same length 2pi interval that the original
values were chosen from.
For more information, see the FITPACK_ site about this function.

We want to interpolate it to a global one-degree grid

Finally we interpolate the data.  The

Looking at the original and the interpolated data, one can see that the interpolant reproduces the original data very well:
Choosing the optimal value of
can be a delicate task. Recommended values for
depend on the accuracy of the data values.  If the user has an idea of the statistical errors on the data, she can also find a proper estimate for
. By assuming that, if she specifies the right
, the interpolator will use a spline
which exactly reproduces the function underlying the data, she can evaluate
to find a good estimate for this
. For example, if she knows that the statistical errors on her
-values are not greater than 0.1, she may expect that a good
should have a value not larger than
If nothing is known about the statistical error in
must be determined by trial and error.  The best is then to start with a very large value of
(to determine the least-squares polynomial and the corresponding upper bound
for
) and then to progressively decrease the value of
(say by a factor 10 in the beginning, i.e.
and more carefully as the approximation shows more detail) to obtain closer fits.
The interpolation results for different values of
give some insight into this process:
a base class for bivariate splines.
a smooth univariate spline to fit a given set of data points.
a smoothing bivariate spline through the given points
a bivariate spline using weighted least-squares fitting
a smoothing bivariate spline in spherical coordinates
a bivariate spline in spherical coordinates using weighted least-squares fitting
a bivariate spline over a rectangular mesh.
a function to find a bivariate B-spline representation of a surface
a function to evaluate a bivariate B-spline and its derivatives

signature: RectSphereBivariateSpline(u, v, r, s=0.0, pole_continuity=False, pole_values=None, pole_exact=False, pole_flat=False)
